page.title: 08THE M1 MOTORWAY
page.content: The{M1 Motorway}stretches{188 miles from{London}in the south to{Leeds}in the north. The section which separates {Brinsworth}and{Catcliffe}is unusual in that it veers{east-west}cross-country in order to skirt{Rotherham.}Traffic moves very quickly on the motorway but must not go above{70 miles an hour.} There are three lanes on each carriageway with the slowest vehicles keeping to the inside lane. If cars break down they pull in on the{hard {shoulder.}Telephones in special boxes can be used to call for help. No{ {learner}drivers are allowed on the motorway because of the dangers to themselves and other drivers. The exit at{Catcliffe}takes cars into{Sheffield}and{Rotherham. { }There are many advantages in using the motorway but{pollution}from{noise} and{fumes}is a big problem.
